Allelic analysis using Salmon and Swish

02/06/2022

Source: vignettes/allelic.Rmd
allelic.Rmd

Allelic analysis

Linking transcripts to TSS 

suppressPackageStartupMessages(library(ensembldb))
library(EnsDb.Hsapiens.v86)
library(fishpond)
edb <- EnsDb.Hsapiens.v86
t2t <- makeTx2Tss(edb)
mcols(t2t)[,c("tx_id","group_id")]
## DataFrame with 216741 rows and 2 columns
##                           tx_id               group_id
##                     <character>            <character>
## ENST00000456328 ENST00000456328  ENSG00000223972-11869
## ENST00000450305 ENST00000450305  ENSG00000223972-12010
## ENST00000488147 ENST00000488147  ENSG00000227232-29570
## ENST00000619216 ENST00000619216  ENSG00000278267-17436
## ENST00000473358 ENST00000473358  ENSG00000243485-29554
## ...                         ...                    ...
## ENST00000420810 ENST00000420810 ENSG00000224240-2654..
## ENST00000456738 ENST00000456738 ENSG00000227629-2659..
## ENST00000435945 ENST00000435945 ENSG00000237917-2663..
## ENST00000435741 ENST00000435741 ENSG00000231514-2662..
## ENST00000431853 ENST00000431853 ENSG00000235857-5685..

Importing allelic counts 

suppressPackageStartupMessages(library(SummarizedExperiment))

Testing for allelic imbalance 

set.seed(1)
se <- makeSimSwishData(allelic=TRUE)
se <- labelKeep(se)
se <- swish(se, x="allele", pair="sample")
mcols(se)
## DataFrame with 1000 rows and 7 columns
##                keep log10mean      stat      log2FC      pvalue    locfdr
##           <logical> <numeric> <numeric>   <numeric>   <numeric> <numeric>
## gene-1         TRUE   2.00348     54.90    0.531087 1.00200e-05 0.0130068
## gene-2         TRUE   2.00220     55.00    0.545229 1.00200e-05 0.0130068
## gene-3         TRUE   1.99912     40.90    0.632622 6.01202e-05 0.0705987
## gene-4         TRUE   2.00869     41.35    0.541153 6.01202e-05 0.0705987
## gene-5         TRUE   1.93861      9.90   -0.194192 2.48196e-02 1.0000000
## ...             ...       ...       ...         ...         ...       ...

Plotting results 

plotInfReps(se, idx=1, x="allele", cov="sample")
